leads.lead_text: Outer perianth bearded with a patch of yellow hairs on midvein; leaves 2.5–4.0 cm wide
Outer perianth not bearded (but papillose yellow streak sometimes present on petal midvein toward base) ; leaves 1–3 cm wide; terrestrial plants

Flowers dull purple-grey or brown; petals lacking contrasting yellow 'signal' below stigma lobes, veins conspicuously darker than background colour; seeds bright red; flowers and crushed leaves unpleasantly odorous; terrestrial plants

Flowers rich magenta, maroon or purple; petals with contrasting yellow 'signal' just below stigma lobes, not strongly veined laterally; seeds brown or reddish-brown, but not bright red; not malodorous; aquatic or semi-aquatic plants
Flowers yellow; inner perianth 2–4 cm long
Flowers white with yellow marks on outer perianth; inner perianth 4.5–6.0 cm long
